org.gearvrf.scene_objects

Class GVRCameraSceneObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRSceneObject
        • org.gearvrf.scene_objects.GVRCameraSceneObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRDrawFrameListener, IEventReceiver, PrettyPrint, IScriptable

    public class GVRCameraSceneObject
extends GVRSceneObject
implements GVRDrawFrameListener
    A scene object that shows live video from one of the device's cameras

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GVRCameraSceneObject.GVRCameraAccessException
      This Exception is returned when the GVRCameraSceneObject cannot be instantiated when the camera is not available.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.gearvrf.GVRSceneObject

        GVRSceneObject.BoundingVolume, GVRSceneObject.ComponentVisitor, GVRSceneObject.SceneVisitor

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject

        GVRHybridObject.CleanupHandlerListManager, GVRHybridObject.NativeCleanupHandler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, float width, float height)
      Create a 2D, rectangular scene object that shows live video from one of the device's cameras.
      GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, float width, float height, Camera camera)
      Deprecated. 
      This call does not ensure the activity lifecycle is correctly handled by the GVRCameraSceneObject. Use GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext, float, float) instead.
      GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, GVRMesh mesh)
      Create a scene object (with arbitrarily complex geometry) that shows live video from one of the device's cameras
      GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, GVRMesh mesh, Camera camera)
      Deprecated. 
      This call does not ensure the activity lifecycle is correctly handled by the GVRCameraSceneObject. Use GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext, GVRMesh) instead.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRCameraSceneObject

        public GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                            GVRMesh mesh,
                            Camera camera)
        Deprecated. This call does not ensure the activity lifecycle is correctly handled by the GVRCameraSceneObject. Use GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext, GVRMesh) instead.
        Create a scene object (with arbitrarily complex geometry) that shows live video from one of the device's cameras
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        mesh - an arbitrarily complex GVRMesh object - see GVRContext#loadMesh(org.gearvrf.GVRAndroidResource) and GVRContext.createQuad(float, float)
        camera - an Android Camera. Note: this constructor calls Camera#setPreviewTexture(SurfaceTexture) so you should be sure to call it before you call Camera#startPreview().

      • GVRCameraSceneObject

        public GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                            GVRMesh mesh)
                     throws GVRCameraSceneObject.GVRCameraAccessException
        Create a scene object (with arbitrarily complex geometry) that shows live video from one of the device's cameras
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        mesh - an arbitrarily complex GVRMesh object - see GVRContext#loadMesh(org.gearvrf.GVRAndroidResource) and GVRContext.createQuad(float, float)
        Throws:
        GVRCameraSceneObject.GVRCameraAccessException - returns this exception when the camera cannot be initialized correctly.

      • GVRCameraSceneObject

        public GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                            float width,
                            float height,
                            Camera camera)
        Deprecated. This call does not ensure the activity lifecycle is correctly handled by the GVRCameraSceneObject. Use GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext, float, float) instead.
        Create a 2D, rectangular scene object that shows live video from one of the device's cameras
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        width - the scene rectangle's width
        height - the rectangle's height
        camera - an Android Camera. Note: this constructor calls Camera#setPreviewTexture(SurfaceTexture) so you should be sure to call it before you call Camera#startPreview().

      • GVRCameraSceneObject

        public GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                            float width,
                            float height)
                     throws GVRCameraSceneObject.GVRCameraAccessException
        Create a 2D, rectangular scene object that shows live video from one of the device's cameras.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        width - the scene rectangle's width
        height - the rectangle's height
        Throws:
        GVRCameraSceneObject.GVRCameraAccessException - this exception is returned when the camera cannot be opened.

    • Method Detail

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes camera preview

        Note: pause() and resume() only affect the polling that links the Android Camera to this GVRF scene object: they have no affect on the underlying Camera object.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses camera preview

        Note: pause() and resume() only affect the polling that links the Android Camera to this GVRF scene object: they have no affect on the underlying Camera object.

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the GVRCameraSceneObject.

      • onDrawFrame

        public void onDrawFrame(float drawTime)
        Description copied from interface: GVRDrawFrameListener
        Called each time a frame is drawn. Callbacks are called in subscription-order, after any 'one shot' callbacks and before GVRMain.onStep().
        Specified by:
        onDrawFrame in interface GVRDrawFrameListener
        Parameters:
        drawTime - Seconds since the previous frame - see GVRContext.getFrameTime()

      • setUpCameraForVrMode

        public boolean setUpCameraForVrMode(int fpsMode)
        Configure high fps settings in the camera for VR mode
        Parameters:
        fpsMode - integer indicating the desired fps: 0 means 30 fps, 1 means 60 fps, and 2 means 120 fps. Any other value is invalid.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating the status of the method call. It may be false due to multiple reasons including: 1) supplying invalid fpsMode as the input parameter, 2) VR mode not supported.
